title: Thermo - gas pressure lid with block

content.description: A container with a movable piston contains a sample of an ideal gas. The piston has negligible mass and area <math alttext="0.004 square meter" overflow="scroll"> <mn>0.004</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <msup> <mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </math>. A block with a weight of <math alttext="2,000 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mn>2000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> is placed on the piston, as shown, and the piston-container-gas system is at equilibrium.
content.question: What is the pressure of the gas?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 times 10 to the 5 power pascals" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>
<math alttext="2 times 10 to the 5 power pascals" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4 times 10 to the 5 power pascals" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>
<math alttext="6 times 10 to the 5 power pascals" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6 times 10 to the 5 power pascals" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></math>

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
